comment.author: 27794182@N07
comment._content: There is something fishy about this photograph ! (actually, it is a postcard.)  View it at large size - look at the exposure on the face, then look at the exposure on the uniform. something is off. I think this is a fake. What a joke...  the only thing real about this photo is the bottom half of it ! ..... Historical Spin-doctors at work. (the loyal dog is wonderful).

comment.author: 8023175@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/coolcactus]  i think it's great that it may have been retouched for the postcard printing

comment.author: 27794182@N07
comment._content: This royal person was not standing on this boat. I still love the dog. It is the only thing that is real here. This is not a photograph. It does not belong on flickr.

comment.author: 8023175@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/coolcactus]  The National Maritime Museum would disagree.  Take a look at other photographs (or glass plate negatives) from that time period and you will see similar exposures.  
Please explain what you think we're looking at if it's "not a photograph"

comment.author: 12814971@N00
comment._content: Sorry, Coolcactus, I think you are wrong. Looks to me as if the Prince's face has been dodged a little bit because of a slight overexposure, but nothing in the rest of the shot suggests it is a fake.
